item.title: No wall, no problems | The minute
item.description:
• Transcripts of Trump’s calls with Mexican and Australian leaders published ... Report claims Mueller has grand jury ... Everyone goes on vacation. Today’s politics news by Lauren Gambino

10.44pm BST

Donald Trump was not happy on calls with Mexico’s president, Enrique Peña Nieto, and Australia’s prime minister, Malcolm Turnbull, according to leaked transcripts of their private conversations.

‘Putin was a pleasant call. This is ridiculous’

10.43pm BST

Donald Trump told his Mexican counterpart that his demand that Mexico pay for a border wall was political speak but he’d really prefer Enrique Peña Nieto to go along with it.

‘Psychologically, it means something’

10.43pm BST

You cannot say that to the press. The press is going to go with that and I cannot live with that. You cannot say that to the press because I cannot negotiate under those circumstances.

– Donald Trump to Peña Nieto

10.43pm BST

This may be my favorite Trump line from the transcripts: "we do not have to worry about Canada, we do not even think about them"

10.42pm BST

Trump told Turnbull he thought the refugees “were not going to be wonderful people who go on to work for the local milk people”. The internet went wild.

‘You are worse than I am’

10.42pm BST

Local milk people pic.twitter.com/m0JtvzKsz3

10.42pm BST

Local milk people pic.twitter.com/HXsbYq1kJG

10.42pm BST

The special counsel Robert Mueller has impaneled a grand jury to investigate Russia’s interference in the US presidential election, according to the Wall Street Journal. Reuters reported that subpoenas have been sent in connection with the meeting involving Donald Trump Jr and the Russian lawyer Natalia Veselnitskaya.

Read the WSJ story

10.41pm BST

Russia was found to have meddled in the US election but Trump blamed Congress for the the icy relationship between Russia and the US. He said relations were at an “all-time & very dangerous low”.

Bipartisan effort to protect Mueller

10.41pm BST

Thanks, Congress

Our relationship with Russia is at an all-time & very dangerous low. You can thank Congress, the same people that can't even give us HCare!

10.41pm BST

Air Force One is en route to Huntington, West Virginia, where Trump will hold a campaign-style rally. He has teased a “very big” announcement.

And after that ... vacation

10.41pm BST

The House is already gone for August recess and the Senate is on its way out the door. The session has so far been big on drama and short on legislative business.

10.40pm BST

Fewer than 10 bills have passed Senate that requiring a roll call. They include giving St Louis a single steamboat.https://t.co/QCP72Vy00V

10.40pm BST

It might take just a minute to catch up on the latest politics news. But good journalism takes time and costs money. If you like the Guardian’s politics coverage, please make a contribution. Thanks for reading!

Make a contribution today

10.40pm BST

I say dinner, she says brews. My friends know me well. Thanks @lisamurkowski #Alaska #IPA #MadeInAmerica pic.twitter.com/gc0zo0H5xf

10.40pm BST

Like Trump, the Minute occasionally needs a vacation, and will be retreating to its private golf club over August for a bit of R&R. We’ll be back in September. Until then, stay in the loop with our daily email of top stories.

Sign up for Guardian US Today

Continue reading...

item.title: Trump signs 'flawed' Russia sanctions
item.description:
• Trump signs ‘seriously flawed’ Russia sanctions package ... Crackdown on legal immigration ... The Mooch goes ‘dark’
  • Get the day’s politics news in 60 seconds every weekday. By Lauren Gambino

10.37pm BST

Donald Trump begrudgingly approved a package of new sanctions on Russia that limits his own authority to reverse or relax them. Trump called it “seriously flawed” and “clearly unconstitutional”. In a separate statement, he bragged that he “built a truly great company worth many billions of dollars” and “can make far better deals with foreign countries than Congress”.

10.37pm BST

The senior White House aide Stephen Miller turned up at the daily press briefing to pitch the administration’s new plan to limit legal immigration. It quickly descended into a debate over the Statue of Liberty.

White House aide gets into argument

10.36pm BST

Trump said the leader of the Boy Scouts called to praise a controversial speech he gave last week. The Scouts said the call never happened. Trump also said Mexico’s president, Enrique Peña Nieto, called him to praise a drop in border crossings. You can guess the rest.

10.35pm BST

A solid majority of Americans disapprove of Trump’s job performance, according to a new survey. The survey said that 33% approve of how Trump is doing his job, compared with 61% who disapprove. Some 54% said they were embarrassed to have him as president, 62% that he was not honest, and 71% that he was not level-headed.

Read the Quinnipiac Poll

10.34pm BST

The Mooch’s wild ride in the White House came to a screeching halt on Monday after just 10 days on the job. In an interview with the Huffington Post, he offered a glimpse of what comes next. “I am now going to go dark,” Scaramucci said. “Then I will re-emerge … As me.”

Dark knight rises

10.34pm BST

John Kelly is reportedly bringing order to the House of Trump with Potus on his best behavior. Axios reports that Trump is eager to impress the four-star general, “picking up his game by acting sharper in meetings and even rattling off stats”.

Raising his game

10.33pm BST

Press: nobody will top Scaramucci's performance in the briefing room.
Miller: Hold my beer.

10.33pm BST

You just typed "senior Scouts source." What a world we live in now https://t.co/zHzfVywWDJ

Continue reading...
item.dc:creator: Guardian Staff

item.title: Trump 'weighed in' on junior's words, says White House | The minute
item.description:
• President did what ‘any father would’, says spokeswoman ... as ex-generals slam trans ban
  • Get the day’s politics news in 60 seconds every weekday. By Paul Owen

10.38pm BST

The White House press secretary, Sarah Huckabee Sanders, seemed to confirm that Donald Trump was personally involved in drafting an initial misleading statement from his son Donald Jr about his meeting with a Russian lawyer.

‘As any father would’

10.37pm BST

The statement that Don Jr issued is true. There’s no inaccuracy in the statement. The president weighed in as any father would, based on the limited information that he had.

– Sarah Huckabee Sanders

10.37pm BST

The Washington Post reported on Monday night that the president “personally dictated” the statement from Don Jr, which said he and Natalia Veselnitskaya “primarily discussed a program about the adoption of Russian children” when they met in June 2016.

10.36pm BST

We primarily discussed a program about the adoption of Russian children that was active and popular with American families years ago and was since ended by the Russian government, but it was not a campaign issue at the time and there was no follow-up.

– Donald Trump Jr

10.36pm BST

The former White House ethics lawyer Richard Painter was more worried than Huckabee Sanders. “You’re boxing in a witness into a false story,” he told the Guardian. “That puts them under enormous pressure to turn around and lie under oath to be consistent with their story. I think it’s obstruction of justice.”

Trump ‘obstructed justice’

10.36pm BST

Meanwhile, Trump’s proposed ban on transgender service members faced opposition from more than 50 retired generals and admirals, who warned that the discriminatory policy would degrade military readiness and harm morale.

‘Reverse transgender ban’

10.35pm BST

This proposed ban, if implemented, would cause significant disruptions, deprive the military of mission-critical talent and compromise the integrity of transgender troops who would be forced to live a lie.

– Letter from 50+ retired generals

10.35pm BST

The US commander-in-chief’s attitude towards the police also prompted criticism. The acting director of the DEA criticized Trump for telling law enforcement officers not to be “too nice” to suspects, saying he felt compelled to speak out when “something is wrong”.

Acting agency chief speaks out

10.34pm BST

The president, in remarks delivered … in New York, condoned police misconduct regarding the treatment of individuals placed under arrest by law enforcement.

– Chuck Rosenberg

10.34pm BST

Do you recall Anthony Scaramucci, the White House communications director hired on 21 July and fired on 31 July? He had one more treat in store: a British hoaxer pretended to be his bête noire Reince Preibus and drew the Mooch into a series of ill-advised emails.

Prankster targeted Scaramucci

10.33pm BST

Read Shakespeare. Particularly Othello … You know what you did. We all do. Even today. But rest assured we were prepared. A Man would apologize.

– Scaramucci to ‘Priebus’

10.33pm BST

10.32pm BST

‘So Fuckin’ Sorry To Hear About This Shit,’ Reads Outpouring Of Sympathetic Texts From Scaramucci’s Friends, Family https://t.co/9EqJT0wfP9 pic.twitter.com/4RAPDleXSZ

10.32pm BST

It emerged that Trump’s former press secretary, Sean Spicer, was given advance notice about a sensational but later retracted Fox News story on the murder of Democratic aide Seth Rich, whose death has spawned numerous rightwing conspiracy theories.

Spicer had notice of story

10.31pm BST

It might take just a minute to catch up on the latest politics news. But good journalism takes time and costs money. If you like the Guardian’s politics coverage, please make a contribution. Thanks for reading!

Make a contribution today

10.31pm BST

Only the Fake News Media and Trump enemies want me to stop using Social Media (110 million people). Only way for me to get the truth out!

10.31pm BST

We don't want you to stop social media. We want you to stop being president.

10.30pm BST

This is amazing. The president asks a journalist about Scotland's independence plans, then immediately pivots to golf: pic.twitter.com/s9b1MFG1zE

10.29pm BST

The president of the United States says he asks foreign leaders how many people their countries have, and then is amazed. pic.twitter.com/FonpzkboE6

10.28pm BST

Monday: "There were disagreements all over camp," Boy Scout says about Trump's Jamboree speech https://t.co/9I2SZvt9V0 pic.twitter.com/HwY2hfIxI2

Continue reading...

item.title: Mooch ado about nothing | The minute
item.description:
• Anthony Scaramucci removed, escorted from White House after just 10 days as communications director ... as Trump assures “no WH chaos”
  • Get the day’s politics news in 60 seconds every weekday. By Jamiles Lartey

10.28pm BST

Anthony Scaramucci, the controversial White House communications director, resigned on Monday, just 10 days into being announced for the role and two weeks before his official start date.

The Mooch is loose

10.28pm BST

It was reported that the new White House chief of staff, John Kelly, ordered the move, and that Scaramucci was essentially escorted from the property.

10.27pm BST

A Dem source just summarized Trump's White House to me (with authorization to repeat on background): pic.twitter.com/w5PWCbThk4

10.27pm BST

I've had Tinder hook-ups that lasted longer than the Mooch

10.27pm BST

Some will win some will lose, some are born to sing the bluuuze!

10.27pm BST

The new White House chief of staff, John Kelly, was sworn in and Trump held his first cabinet meeting since Reince Priebus was sacked last week.

10.26pm BST

Senior staffers expect that Kelly will instill “discipline and a clear chain of command” in the White House.

Read more

10.26pm BST

The Republican National Committee, while stating that it “has not been contacted” regarding any investigations into the Trump administration, has ordered its staff not to delete or modify any documents related to the 2016 campaign.

10.25pm BST

Trump has yet to respond to news that Vladimir Putin has ordered the expulsion of 755 US diplomats and other employees in Russia in response to new sanctions.

10.24pm BST

The US sanctions, which passed overwhelmingly in the House and Senate, target Russia for its interference in the 2016 election and were slowed until now, over objections from the White House.

Read more

10.24pm BST

Trump, in Cabinet meeting today: "We'll handle North Korea. We'll be able to handle it. It will be handled. We can handle everything." pic.twitter.com/tBCKHZNFAM

10.24pm BST

Props to the Ann Arbor VA. pic.twitter.com/eOJ1FNsGG7

Continue reading...

item.title: Trump shrugs as health bill, Priebus go kablooey | The minute
item.description:
• ‘You can’t have everything’, president says, after failure to deliver on key campaign plank… then he fires chief of staff Priebus
  • Get the day’s politics news in 60 seconds every weekday. By Tom McCarthy

10.30pm BST

In a dramatic wee-hours vote on Friday, a Republican plan to dismantle the Affordable Care Act collapsed, with three GOP senators – Susan Collins, Lisa Murkowski and John McCain – voting ‘No’. McCain then returned to Arizona for cancer treatment.

McCain was last ‘No’ aboard

10.29pm BST

Protesters outside the Capitol sent up a cheer as the imminent threat to Barack Obama’s healthcare law receded. Donald Trump, however, declared that he would now let the law “implode” – perhaps by suspending subsidies or other sabotage.

The GOP trio who voted No

10.29pm BST

After weeks of rumors, White House Chief of Staff Reince Priebus got the axe late on Friday, in a Trump tweet, of course. The president replaced Priebus with Homeland Security Secretary John Kelly.

10.28pm BST

Trump so far has fired or driven out:
* NSA
* Deputy AG
* FBI director
* Comms director
* Press Sec
* Chief of staff

10.28pm BST

“I said from the beginning: Let Obamacare implode, and then do it. I turned out to be right. Let Obamacare implode.” — President Trump

10.28pm BST

In the end, the president's closing message – that his attorney general is terrible – couldn't put the bill over the top

10.28pm BST

10.28pm BST

In a speech to police officers on Long Island, NY, the president glossed over the failure of health reform, which he had vowed to achieve on “Day One”. “You can’t have everything,” Trump said. Then he gave a horrorshow speech about gangs.

Will Trump ‘implode’ Obamacare?

10.27pm BST

President urges officers to commit acts of brutality, officers laugh and cheer wildly. Beginning to think problem isn't a few bad apples. pic.twitter.com/o1sSgw6lGy

10.26pm BST

Peaceful Long Island neighborhoods have become "blood-stained killing fields," says @POTUS. "They're animals." pic.twitter.com/IJPbfWAfqj

10.26pm BST

this is a sick, hateful speech https://t.co/ljeoLkS46l

10.25pm BST

Despite the relative current popularity of Obamacare and the failure of either house of Congress to pass a viable replacement bill, the House speaker Paul Ryan said: “I am disappointed and frustrated, but we should not give up.”

10.24pm BST

I would like to thank Reince Priebus for his service and dedication to his country. We accomplished a lot together and I am proud of him!

10.24pm BST

John McCain is an American hero & one of the bravest fighters I've ever known. Cancer doesn't know what it's up against. Give it hell, John.

10.24pm BST

He might fire everyone. But she just fired him. > Anthony Scaramucci's wife files for divorce https://t.co/pLpAYIXmVq via @pagesix

Continue reading...

item.title: Senate slumber party: healthcare on the brink | The minute
item.description:
• Sleeping cots come out… Republicans back bill they fear will be signed into law… new Clinton memoir
  • Get the day’s politics news in 60 seconds every weekday. By Tom McCarthy

10.37pm BST

Sleeping cots were rolled out in anticipation of late-night legislating in the Senate, where Republicans were desperate to pass a bill to send to the House, but fearful that the House then would actually sign the thing. Healthcare for millions of Americans was on the line.

Read our live coverage

10.37pm BST

The bill Republicans were working on, a so-called skinny repeal, would make minor tweaks to Barack Obama’s healthcare law, the idea being that the House and Senate could get together later to take real action… if only Senate Republicans can keep the process alive.

What is a skinny repeal?

10.37pm BST

I’d rather get out of the way and let it collapse, than have a half-assed solution that is our problem … I’m not going to vote for a pig in a poke.

– Republican senator Lindsey Graham, on the “skinny repeal”, casting doubt on the current plan

10.36pm BST

The head of the Boy Scouts of America apologized for “political rhetoric that was inserted” into its national gathering this week in a speech by Donald Trump. “I want to extend my sincere apologies to those in our Scouting family who were offended,” he said.

Read our coverage

10.36pm BST

I was at that event and I saw nothing but roughly 40 to 45,000 Boy Scouts cheering the president on throughout his remarks, and I think they were pretty excited that he was there and happy to hear him speak to them.

– Sarah Huckabee Sanders, White House press secretary

10.36pm BST

After implying in a (since deleted) tweet late Wednesday that White House chief of staff Reince Priebus had leaked his financial disclosure form, new communications director Anthony Scaramucci said he and Priebus were like brothers – Cain and Abel, that is.

10.36pm BST

I fired one guy the other day. I have three to four people I’ll fire tomorrow. I’ll get to the person who leaked that to you. Reince Priebus – if you want to leak something – he’ll be asked to resign very shortly.

– White House communications director Anthony Scaramucci, to the New Yorker

10.35pm BST

Attorney general Jeff Sessions said that the continuous attacks on him by the president were “kind of hurtful,” but he told AP that he would continue to serve as long as Trump wanted him to.

Jeff: he’s just not that into you

10.35pm BST

US defense chiefs have pushed back against Donald Trump’s attempt to ban transgender people from serving in the military, saying the policy would not be overturned until they received formal direction to do so.

Read our coverage

10.35pm BST

Hillary Clinton announced she would publish a new memoir about the 2016 presidential race, to be titled What Happened. (No question mark.)

10.35pm BST

Lindsay Graham: "Any effort to go after Mueller could be the beginning of the end of the Trump presidency." pic.twitter.com/CZGyL8i3D5

10.35pm BST

Members of the band Journey were just spotted in the White House briefing room. That is all.

10.35pm BST

Scaramucci also told @RyanLizza that, unlike other senior officials, he had no interest in media attention: https://t.co/gXOwqDdR5C pic.twitter.com/DynPX9CGdn

Continue reading...

item.title: Trump tweets expulsion of transgender troops | The minute
item.description:
• Pentagon taken by surprise… White House offers no details… Healthcare saga grinds on… Sessions in limbo
  • Get the day’s politics news in 60 seconds every weekday. By Tom McCarthy

10.33pm BST

Donald Trump announced on Twitter that “the United States government will not accept or allow transgender individuals to serve in any capacity in the US military.” Trump cited “tremendous medical costs and disruption” as reasons.

Read our coverage

10.33pm BST

Asked whether the tweets meant that thousands of transgender troops currently serving would be sent home, press secretary Sarah Huckabee Sanders drew a blank, feeding the impression that the policy change was recklessly extemporized, a red herring, or both.

‘Medical costs’ excuse is BS

10.33pm BST

Thank you to the LGBT community! I will fight for you while Hillary brings in more people that will threaten your freedoms and beliefs.

10.33pm BST

After another day of the president insulting his attorney general on Twitter, Huckabee Sanders claimed that Trump did not want Sessions to resign. “You can be disappointed in someone but still want them to continue to do their job,” she said.

10.32pm BST

After legislation to repeal Barack Obama’s healthcare law was voted down (again), Senate Republicans prepared a vote (again) on legislation that would carve up the law without summarily erasing it. Legislators admitted ignorance of what they were voting on.

Republicans push ‘skinny repeal’

10.32pm BST

Mike Lee: I don't know what the skinny bill is

10.32pm BST

The shards that cut me the deepest were the ones that intended to cut. Knowing that after eight years of working really hard for this country, there are still people who won’t see me for what I am because of my skin color.

– Michelle Obama, to an audience in Colorado

10.32pm BST

Former Trump campaign chairman Paul Manafort met privately with Senate investigators on Tuesday to talk about a June 2016 meeting with Donald Trump Jr and Russian agents. Manafort reportedly agreed to turn over his notes from the meeting.

Read our coverage

10.32pm BST

pic.twitter.com/1Xq1ACuYDl

Continue reading...

item.title: Repeal gets real ... or does it? | The minute
item.description:
• Senate votes to start debate on Obamacare repeal ... Trump offends families with Boy Scouts speech ... tensions build with Sessions
  • Get the day’s politics news in 60 seconds every weekday. By Jamiles Lartey

11.04pm BST

Senator John McCain, who was diagnosed last week with brain cancer, returned to the Senate floor to vote for debate on repeal of Obamacare to move forward. He was one of 50 Republican Senators who voted to advance, while two GOP and 48 Democratic Senators voted no.

11.04pm BST

Senate Republicans will now probably be forced to pursue one of three options: a previously discarded plan to replace the 2010 healthcare law; a measure that repeals it without implementing a replacement; and a so-called “skinny repeal” that would eliminate certain pieces of the law but leave many intact.

Read more

11.03pm BST

“I will not vote for this bill as it is today,” McCain says on the Senate floor, after voting to proceed to healthcare debate.

11.02pm BST

Many political observers were confused by the fact that McCain’s speech from the Senate floor seemed to be critical of almost everything he was in effect voting for by allowing the process to move forward.

11.02pm BST

Sure sounds like McCain just declared this repeal process dead. He, Collins and Murkowski can kill any bill produced by this process. https://t.co/ylymslo0bR

11.02pm BST

This thing is not over. Not by a long shot. We took a gut punch, but people agree with us, and we should act like it. Keep fighting!

11.01pm BST

Boy Scouts’ families complained after, in a speech at the group’s quadrennial “jamboree”, Trump encouraged boos for Hillary Clinton and Barack Obama and bragged about attending “hot” New York parties.

11.01pm BST

By the way, just a question, did President Obama ever come to a jamboree?”

Read more

11.00pm BST

The rift between Trump and the attorney general, Jeff Sessions, shows no sign of mending with Trump remarking today: “I told you before, I’m very disappointed with the attorney general but we will see what happens. Time will tell.”

11.00pm BST

Attorney General Jeff Sessions has taken a VERY weak position on Hillary Clinton crimes (where are E-mails & DNC server) & Intel leakers!

10.58pm BST

“Sessions is totally pissed off about it… It’s beyond insane. It’s cruel and it’s insane and it’s stupid.” https://t.co/NlRIEmp7cK

10.57pm BST

The following exchange about Trump’s budget was picked up on a hot-mic conversation between Senators Susan Collins and Jack Reed.

Collins: “I mean, it’s just incredibly irresponsible.”

10.57pm BST

The Texas congressman Blake Farenthold on the holdup in the Senate on health reform:

“Some of the people that are opposed to this, there are female senators from the north-east. If it was a guy from south Texas, I might ask him to step outside and settle this Aaron Burr-style.”

10.56pm BST

Collins, one of the senators whom Farenthold was certainly referring to, was also caught on the hot mic responding to his duel-related daydreaming.

“I don’t mean to be unkind but he’s so unattractive – it’s unbelievable,” Collins said. She later apologized.

10.55pm BST

In the movies, John McCain hauls himself from his sickbed, delivers the big speech, then votes No. This ain’t the movies.

Continue reading...

item.title: Kushner speaks: ‘I did not collude’ | The minute
item.description:
• President’s son-in-law defends himself in Russia matter … Trump tells Republicans to advance health bill (or else) ...

• Get the day’s politics news in 60 seconds every weekday. By Tom McCarthy

10.26pm BST

Jared Kushner, Donald Trump’s son-in-law, delivered a rare statement outside the White House on Monday to tell the public what he has told Congress: that the Trump campaign was innocent of underhanded dealings with Russia.

Read our coverage

10.26pm BST

I did not collude, nor know of anyone else in the campaign who colluded, with any foreign government. I had no improper contacts. I have not relied on Russian funds to finance my business activities in the private sector.

– Jared Kushner

10.26pm BST

Kushner was due to return to Capitol Hill on Tuesday to speak with the House intelligence committee, after talking with the Senate on Monday. Donald Trump Jr and Paul Manafort, the former campaign chairman, agreed to submit documents to congressional investigators.

Trump ‘not convinced’

10.26pm BST

In a tweet Monday, Trump called his own attorney general “beleaguered”, after saying last week that if he had known Jeff Sessions would recuse himself from the Russia investigation, he would never have picked him.

10.26pm BST

So why aren't the Committees and investigators, and of course our beleaguered A.G., looking into Crooked Hillarys crimes & Russia relations?

10.26pm BST

Trump rolls his eyes when asked if Sessions should resign; tells reporter to “be quiet” when asked about health carepic.twitter.com/terMPUDSlz

10.25pm BST

Although Sessions said last week that he would stay in his role, it’s unclear how long he might be able to do so without the president’s support. Former New York mayor Rudy Giuliani said Monday that he was not being considered as a replacement, contrary to some reports.

10.25pm BST

Trump warned Senate Republicans to approve a measure to advance a healthcare bill Tuesday. “So far Senate Republicans have not done their job in ending the Obamacare nightmare,” he said, with an ominous edge in his voice.

10.25pm BST

For Senate Republicans, this is their chance to keep their promise. Over and over again they said ‘repeal and replace’, but they can now keep their promise to the American people to provide emergency relief.

– Donald Trump

10.25pm BST

Sleazy Adam Schiff, the totally biased Congressman looking into "Russia," spends all of his time on television pushing the Dem loss excuse!

10.25pm BST

With respect Mr. President, the problem is how often you watch TV, and that your comments and actions are beneath the dignity of the office. https://t.co/NvZydYbnyW

10.25pm BST

Super robust showing for the Democrats' big reveal of their super duper new message pic.twitter.com/baGrH87yl0

10.24pm BST

these pictures make it look like kushner was just emitting a high-pitched screech for like ten minutes straight pic.twitter.com/O0GpftEhEC

10.24pm BST

"You and your little friends will NEVER save the youth center" pic.twitter.com/IvYsDe7BhT

10.24pm BST

“If the president asks you, you don’t say no. I have rocks in my head and steel balls.” - @POTUS lawyer Ty Cobb https://t.co/QQQR0Dtqwn pic.twitter.com/0PoJHVZaoc

10.24pm BST

. @Scaramucci took a private jet to work this morning, no bigs. https://t.co/zFHuoIro9s

Continue reading...

item.title: Spice world comes to an end | The minute
item.description:
• Press secretary resigns… won’t work for new communications director… Priebus ‘furious’... Bannon ‘livid’

• Get the day’s politics news in 60 seconds every weekday. By Tom McCarthy

10.40pm BST

Sean Spicer resigned as press secretary after Donald Trump decided to hire a former hedge fund manager and Trump transition staffer, Anthony Scaramucci, as communications director – aka Spicer’s boss.

Six months and out

10.40pm BST

There was some head-scratching as to why Spicer, who prevaricated energetically for Trump even as Trump contradicted and sidelined him, suddenly resigned over a hiring decision.

Sean Spicer lowlights

10.40pm BST

I won't believe Sean Spicer resigned until he denies it.

10.39pm BST

Scaramucci took questions from reporters after announcing that Sarah Huckabee Sanders would take Spicer’s job. Scaramucci denied friction with Reince Priebus and listed people he loved, especially including the president – but notably excluding Steve Bannon.

Who is Anthony Scaramucci?

10.39pm BST

Reince Priebus furious, per multiple who spoke w him. He has tried blocking Scaramucci at various points.

10.39pm BST

People in Trump world say Bannon remains livid about Scaramucci hiring.

10.39pm BST

Personally, I think baghdad bob is off to a great start.pic.twitter.com/d1wfgN9zFa

10.39pm BST

The healthcare bill is absolutely alive and they're gonna try like hell to jam it through under cover of confusion.

10.39pm BST

Reports that Trump lawyers were digging for dirt on special counsel Robert Mueller fueled speculation that Trump was considering firing him. “There is no possible way anybody at the White House could be seriously thinking about firing Mueller,” GOP senator Bob Corker said.

Democrats: this is disturbing

10.38pm BST

The Senate judiciary committee, which has invited testimony next week from Donald Trump Jr and former campaign chairman Paul Manafort, said it was in talks with representatives of the pair – suggesting the invitation may not have been fully accepted.

Soviet intelligence ties

10.37pm BST

JUST IN: Press secretary for Senate Judiciary Comte says they've still not confirmed Manafort, Don Jr., or Simpson's testimony next week. pic.twitter.com/XXigKsz6TB

10.37pm BST

. @Scaramucci OUT. pic.twitter.com/DI7bux3l2a

10.37pm BST

Will always remember watching this surreal beginning to the Trump administration. pic.twitter.com/SahSoWiWZS

10.37pm BST

In the past, presidents personally announced the appointment or departure of a press secretary. pic.twitter.com/yBVwF8N2of

10.36pm BST

So Sad: Steve Bannon Is The Only One Who Signed Sean Spicer’s Goodbye Card And He Thought It Was A Lunch Order https://t.co/KLw6CAc1fA pic.twitter.com/n0Cb8DriZb

Continue reading...

item.title: Trump on a collision course with justice | The minute
item.description:
• President regrets attorney general pick … warns special counsel not to look into finances … says FBI director reports directly to him

• Get the day’s politics news in 60 seconds every weekday. By Tom McCarthy

10.19pm BST

Attorney general Jeff Sessions insisted he would continue in his job “as long as that is appropriate”, after Donald Trump publicly criticized Sessions for recusing himself from the justice department’s Russia inquiry.

Trump’s Times interview

10.19pm BST

Sessions should have never recused himself, and if he was going to recuse himself, he should have told me before he took the job, and I would have picked somebody else.

– Donald Trump

10.19pm BST

Trump said it would be a “violation” for special counsel Robert Mueller to broaden his investigation of contacts between the Trump campaign and Russian entities to Trump’s past business deals and financing. Mueller reportedly has already done so...

Deutsche Bank expects subpoenas

10.18pm BST

I think that’s a violation. Look, this is about Russia.

– Trump, on Mueller possibly looking into his finances

10.18pm BST

JESUS TAPDANCING CHRIST.

Trump thinks the FBI reports directly to him and only started reporting to DOJ as "courtesy" after Watergate. pic.twitter.com/ZJxbwi5zTb

10.18pm BST

The president is making clear that the special counsel should not move outside the scope of the investigation.

– White House spokeswoman Sarah Huckabee Sanders

10.18pm BST

The justice department is investigating purchases by Russians of apartments in Trump buildings and other Trump organization transactions, Bloomberg reported.

Read the Bloomberg report

10.18pm BST

The Senate judiciary committee is planning to hear next week in a public session from Donald Trump Jr and former Trump campaign chairman Paul Manafort. Jared Kushner, the president’s son-in-law, was to testify in a closed intelligence session.

What will they ask Don Jr?

10.17pm BST

I was seated next to the wife of Prime Minister Abe [Shinzo Abe of Japan], who I think is a terrific guy, and she’s a terrific woman, but doesn’t speak English.

– Donald Trump, on his G20 dinner

10.17pm BST

Looks like the First Lady of Japan pretended not to speak English for nearly 2 hrs to avoid talking to Trump https://t.co/ee9LGHVlDo

10.17pm BST

The euphoria of victory has worn off for Trump voters in Pennsylvania interviewed for our series The Promise. The voters blamed the media and Congress for foiling Trump, and insisted Hillary Clinton would have been worse.

Read our coverage

10.16pm BST

I greatly appreciate the outpouring of support - unfortunately for my sparring partners in Congress, I'll be back soon, so stand-by!

10.16pm BST

I shouldve corrected this immediately; I've deleted original tweet. Full slogan is "A Better Deal: Better Skills, Better Jobs, Better Wages"

10.16pm BST

"That's a luxury we don't have" -@JohnCornyn when asked "don't some people want to know the plan before they vote" on health care.

10.16pm BST

"I invented the Internet"
"No you didn't"
"I can see through brick walls"
"No you can't"
"I own fourteen dinosaurs, all alive"
"Please stop" pic.twitter.com/sbdUFTvVhq

10.15pm BST

Not every day you see your Governor rip a shot on the job #onlyinnh @nhpr #nhpolitics pic.twitter.com/lG6paDuecQ

Continue reading...

item.title: Trump reverses message on healthcare ... again
item.description:
• President tells Republicans to go back to the drawing board … after describing plan to ‘let Obamacare fail’

• Get the day’s politics news in 60 seconds every weekday. By Tom McCarthy

10.42pm BST

Donald Trump hosted Republicans for an awkward lunch in which the president told senators to try yet again to pass a healthcare bill. “For seven years, you promised the American people that you would repeal Obamacare,” Trump said.

Trump changes mind again

10.41pm BST

My message today is very simple. We have to stay here. We shouldn’t leave town until this is complete, until this bill is on my desk. We should hammer this out and get it done.

– Donald Trump

10.41pm BST

I will be having lunch at the White House today with Republican Senators concerning healthcare. They MUST keep their promise to America!

10.41pm BST

CBO on the straight Obamacare repeal:
—17 million more uninsured by 2018
—27 million by 2020
—32 million by 2026https://t.co/hgOJpEHE5z

10.41pm BST

I still don't know what is happening with the Senate health bill but it seems like it boils down to "let's just do it and be legends, man"

10.40pm BST

Kris Kobach, who is running Trump’s “election integrity commission”, was asked whether Hillary Clinton’s 3m popular-vote margin over Trump was real. “We may never know the answer to that question,” he said.

Six ways the president is ‘dismantling’ the US

10.40pm BST

Trump warned darkly of potential voter fraud at the first meeting of his election integrity commission on Wednesday, minutes after its chair, Mike Pence, insisted that the commission had “no preconceived notions”.

Read our coverage

10.39pm BST

It might take just a minute to catch up on the latest politics news. But good journalism takes time and costs money. If you like the Guardian’s politics coverage, please make a contribution. Thanks for reading!

Make a contribution today

10.39pm BST

Here's a graphic we did @nationaljournal on what "many people" are saying. pic.twitter.com/lx9w7oQ8Mp

10.38pm BST

.@MyPillowUSA at the White House. pic.twitter.com/w1nd8TGTLE

10.38pm BST

FIRST PHOTO: WGN Investigates obtains former U.S. House Speaker Dennis Hastert's mugshot. https://t.co/CuzpG7ucmc pic.twitter.com/vkFpT0OsDz

Continue reading...

item.title: Healthcare plan flatlines again
item.description:
• Senate plan ‘B’ fails… then plan ‘C’ fails… Trump plans to blame Democrats… ‘We’re not going to own it’

• Get the day’s politics news in 60 seconds every weekday. By Tom McCarthy

10.52pm BST

After the collapse of a Republican health care reform bill in the Senate Monday night, leader Mitch McConnell declared a new plan, which then immediately collapsed. Barack Obama’s healthcare law lives on…

Last-ditch effort thwarted

10.52pm BST

Donald Trump responded to the news with a plan to “let Obamacare fail” (presumably through executive branch sabotage), have Democrats catch the blame, win additional Republican seats in 2018 and then try again.

Here’s the plan

10.51pm BST

Let Obamacare fail and it will be a lot easier. And I think we’re probably in that position where we’ll let Obamacare fail. We’re not going to own it. I’m not going to own it. I can tell you the Republicans are not going to own it. We’ll let Obamacare fail and then the Democrats are going to come to us.

– Donald Trump

10.50pm BST

On the contrary, a healthy majority of respondents in most recent polls predict that Republicans, who hold a majority in both houses of Congress and the presidency, will catch blame if healthcare reform fails.

Read the polling data

10.50pm BST

As I have always said, let ObamaCare fail and then come together and do a great healthcare plan. Stay tuned!

10.50pm BST

Murkowski, who opposes repeal without a replacement, says McConnell has a tough job tying to keep "all the frogs in the wheelbarrow"

10.50pm BST

Drudge Front Page pic.twitter.com/C6DsjQpovX

10.49pm BST

A limp-dick motherfucker who was born in a petri dish at the Heritage Foundation.

– White House chief strategist Steve Bannon on House speaker Paul Ryan, according to the new book Devil’s Bargain

10.49pm BST

A Russian American businessman once accused of laundering more than $1.4bn into the US from eastern Europe attended the meeting where Donald Trump’s son expected to receive secret information from Moscow.

Read Jon Swaine’s report

10.49pm BST

Trump-Putin had a 2nd private discussion at the G20...for an hour. Really? Really. I discuss with @CharlieRose. https://t.co/nBiBqPUSXK

10.48pm BST

Former House speaker Dennis Hastert, a Republican, was freed from federal prison, where he was consigned for being a “serial child molester”, in the words of the sentencing judge.

Read the report

10.48pm BST

Finally. Here's how Mark Zuckerberg polls against Trump @ppppolls pic.twitter.com/ewXs6abmoR

10.48pm BST

Christie on beach: "Its about the media being sneaky and flying an airplane over it"... "It wasn’t like I said I wasn’t going to be there."

10.48pm BST

Ailes called Bannon:"Steve this isn't fair and its killing us. You have to stop it"

Bannon's retort" "Fuck that"

https://t.co/adjb2f9fUD

Continue reading...

item.title: Trump to McCain: Get well soon. That's an order | The minute
item.description:
• ‘We need that vote’ on healthcare, president says as senator recovers from surgery … ‘Kill the bill’ protests spread … Trump loves trucks

• Get the day’s politics news in 60 seconds every weekday. By Tom McCarthy

10.41pm BST

Donald Trump told reporters he hoped that Republican senator John McCain, 80, who had surgery Friday to remove a blood clot over his eye, “gets better soon”. Republicans need McCain to advance healthcare reform in the Senate.

McCain surgery delays vote

10.41pm BST

He’s a crusty voice in Washington. Plus we need that vote.

– Donald Trump, on John McCain

10.40pm BST

Grassroots activists opposed to the Republican effort to recast Barack Obama’s healthcare law planned a slate of public rallies and protests to make the most of the delay caused by McCain’s absence.

Cruz amendment ‘unworkable’

10.40pm BST

To mark “Made in America” week – an unlikely White House invention – Trump and sidekick Mike Pence looked at trucks. The press secretary deflected questions about most Trump family products being manufactured overseas.

Hypocrisy on display

10.40pm BST

Reporter: "We missed you Sean." Spicer: "I missed you too." pic.twitter.com/U9W3wb7w3i

10.40pm BST

Forty former US diplomats and national security officials urged secretary of state Rex Tillerson not to eliminate the state department’s refugee office, as described in a recently uncovered internal memo.

Read our coverage

10.40pm BST

Trump at six months. Link is slightly more verbose than 140 characters.https://t.co/LvEbL5DVVp pic.twitter.com/EljWTSxpAX

10.40pm BST

uh oh, someone find mother ASAP pic.twitter.com/Wk7LJCsh8D

10.40pm BST

.@POTUS: "We've signed more bills... than any president ever." pic.twitter.com/XTKyGP33vB

Continue reading...

item.title: Trump Jr meeting had mystery guest(s) | The minute
item.description:
• Ex-Soviet counterintelligence officer attended meeting, too… DNC documents changed hands… were other people there too?

• Get the day’s politics news in 60 seconds every weekday. By Tom McCarthy

9.52pm BST

It emerged that Rinat Akhmetshin, a pro-Moscow lobbyist said to have served in a Soviet-era counterintelligence unit, also was at a “nothingburger” June 2016 meeting with Donald Trump Jr.

Read our coverage

9.51pm BST

Akhmetshin told AP that a Russian lawyer present gave Trump Jr documents detailing what she believed were illicit funds flowing to the Democratic National Committee. Nine days later, a hacker linked to Moscow dumped DNC documents online.

Get to know Rinat Akhmetshin

9.51pm BST

pic.twitter.com/6ymv34S5GX

9.51pm BST

Speculation mounts... https://t.co/uGTPhiyUyf

9.51pm BST

Brad Parscale, digital director for the Trump campaign, released a statement saying: “I am unaware of any Russian involvement in the digital and data operations of the 2016 Trump presidential campaign.” Parscale has accepted invite to testify before Congress.

Get to know Trump Jr

9.50pm BST

Both the president and Jared Kushner, his son-in-law, made changes in their legal teams handling the Russia matter.

Hiring the best lawyers

9.50pm BST

Donald Trump returned from France on Friday and headed to his New Jersey golf course. The president’s brief attendance at Bastille Day celebrations went smoothly apart from a marching band cover of Daft Punk and one extremely strange handshake.

Macron rolls out the red carpet

9.50pm BST

This is honestly the weirdest and most performative shit pic.twitter.com/kwXdIyh1c1

9.50pm BST

I cannot get over the different reactions Trump and Macron had to this marching band playing Daft Punk. pic.twitter.com/KAjXPp9Lff

9.49pm BST

Lawyers for Jared Kushner said his security clearance forms originally omitted about 100 foreign contacts and/or meetings because “a member of his staff had prematurely hit the ‘send’ button for the firm before it was completed”, Yahoo reported.

Read the report

9.49pm BST

Experts tell me any clearance holder who failed to disclose 100 foreign contacts, as Kushner did, would be toast. https://t.co/mjTglS3bvb

9.49pm BST

What book is Jared Kushner, the man tasked with brokering peace in the middle East, reading? Shoe Dog, a memoir by the CEO of Nike. pic.twitter.com/s5ixY20Bi6

9.49pm BST

“’Why do you think I know more about that than he does?’” Graham said Trump asked. “And then he hung up." https://t.co/J8sTRHJECs pic.twitter.com/zLY19r1n6l

9.48pm BST

New Yorker cover, next week --> pic.twitter.com/3wIBtjR7zX

9.48pm BST

Bill Clinton with a much-needed show of bipartisan levity. pic.twitter.com/3XB2OFIS3h

9.48pm BST

and we have a winner--> pic.twitter.com/zMictvljMx

9.48pm BST

My British-born husband takes his oath of citizenship today. In the packet for new Americans, the welcome letter from POTUS is from Obama. pic.twitter.com/O56cMj0hhx

Continue reading...

item.title: Trump goes to Paris, still can't duck Russia | The minute
item.description:
• ‘Most people would have taken that meeting’, Trump says of son ... Republicans try again on healthcare

• Get the day’s politics news in 60 seconds every weekday. By Tom McCarthy

10.03pm BST

Donald Trump said “nothing happened” at his son Donald Jr’s meeting last summer with a Russian lawyer. “Most people would have taken that meeting,” Trump said at a joint press conference in Paris with French president Emmanuel Macron.

Trump visits Paris

10.03pm BST

Wonderful young man. He took a meeting with a Russian lawyer … it was a short meeting. It was a meeting that went very very quickly, very fast ... I think from a practical standpoint, most people would have taken that meeting. It’s called opposition research, or even research into your opponent.

– Donald Trump, on his son

10.03pm BST

I've been in & around politics for 40 years-at highest levels of 4 presidential campaigns. Crazy to say Jr's Russia meeting was standard.

10.03pm BST

Can we move on from this fake "oppo" debate? Meeting with agents of foreign dictators is not "opposition research". Nor is it normal.

10.03pm BST

Republicans largely gave Trump a pass on the Russian support for his campaign, but Republican senator Chuck Grassley did say he wanted Trump Jr to testify before the judiciary committee and would issue a subpoena if necessary.

Trump camp sued over DNC hack

10.03pm BST

You want to watch this: Trey Gowdy is fuming at the White House, is not ready to put up with this any longer. pic.twitter.com/TfxkxRPFu4

10.03pm BST

Taking Macron up on an invitation to visit before Bastille Day celebrations Friday, Trump and first lady Melania Trump arrived in Paris, where Trump praised the Franco-American alliance and the first couples went for dinner at the Eiffel Tower.

10.02pm BST

WATCH: POTUS to Mrs. Macron: "You're in such good shape. She's in such good physical shape. Beautiful." pic.twitter.com/DvJPF6aT5l

10.02pm BST

Senate majority leader Mitch McConnell was teetering on the brink of another failure (or victory this time?) to advance healthcare legislation, with several GOP senators voicing skepticism of a supposedly new bill that looks like the old bill.

Meet the new bill, same as the old bill

10.02pm BST

Pres. Trump on Air Force 1 last night: "I'd say the only thing more difficult than peace between Israel and the Palestinians is healthcare."

10.02pm BST

Trump said the border wall with Mexico should be transparent because otherwise flying drugs could kill people.

Voter purge panel pulls up

10.01pm BST

One of the things with the wall is you need transparency … As horrible as it sounds, when they throw the large sacks of drugs over, and if you have people on the other side of the wall, you don’t see them – they hit you on the head with 60 pounds of stuff? It’s over. As cray [sic] as that sounds, you need transparency through that wall.

– Donald Trump

10.01pm BST

When drug smugglers hit @realDonaldTrump's wall pic.twitter.com/w0gkxMeL91

10.01pm BST

McConnell: I am rejecting all your amendments and also renaming it the "Marco Rubio Suuuucks Bill."

Rubio: I am a reluctant yes. https://t.co/YYOekTFq11

Continue reading...

item.title: Trump backs son and blasts Russia 'witch hunt' | The minute
item.description:
• New twists in Trump Jr caper… ‘The WH is functioning perfectly’… Kid Rock for Senate?

• Get the day’s politics news in 60 seconds every weekday. By Tom McCarthy

10.53pm BST

Donald Trump dismissed emails in which his son embraced an offer of Russian support for his presidential campaign, reverting to flat denials of any ties to Moscow and calling investigations of such ties a “witch hunt”.

20 denials of Russian ties

10.53pm BST

The president tweeted a day after Donald Trump Jr appeared on Fox to explain having jumped at the chance to catch Russian dirt on Clinton. Trump Jr called the meeting a “bait-and-switch” and said there was no dirt after all.

Hannity vs Trump Jr

10.53pm BST

My son Donald did a good job last night. He was open, transparent and innocent. This is the greatest Witch Hunt in political history. Sad!

10.53pm BST

The W.H. is functioning perfectly, focused on HealthCare, Tax Cuts/Reform & many other things. I have very little time for watching T.V.

10.52pm BST

Jared Kushner’s White House security clearance should be “re-evaluated” after the revelation that he attended a now notorious meeting with Donald Trump Jr and a Russian lawyer, according to a former White House ethics tsar.

Read our coverage

10.52pm BST

People said, ‘Oh, they shouldn’t get along’. Well, who are the people that are saying that? I think we get along very, very well. We are a tremendously powerful nuclear power, and so are they. It doesn’t make sense not to have some kind of a relationship.

– Donald Trump, to the Christian Broadcasting Network

10.52pm BST

Christopher Wray, Trump’s nominee to replace James Comey as FBI director, testified that he did not consider the special counsel to be on a “witch hunt.” Senator Lindsey Graham pressed him to elaborate.

The search for Jim

10.51pm BST

Watch: Graham & Wray over Don Jr/Russia: “You’re gonna be the director of the FBI, pal…tell us all to call the FBI!” https://t.co/QfOXMQyN6J

10.51pm BST

I have had a ton of emails and texts asking me if this website is real… https://t.co/RRVgISDFeq The answer is an absolute YES. pic.twitter.com/uYCUg6mjW1

10.50pm BST

The link redirects to Warner Brothers' merchandise store and there is no paid for. Unless Kid Rock comes down an escalator, this isn't real https://t.co/clg8W5jGll

10.50pm BST

Asked if he'd take meeting with foreign source offering campaign info, @SpeakerRyan says "I'm not going to go into hypotheticals." pic.twitter.com/ONemfDJsYJ

10.50pm BST

"Jared Kosher" pic.twitter.com/VqFXkQNczR

10.49pm BST

Oh my God it's happened.

POTUS has become The Orb https://t.co/iWtO5boYa5

10.49pm BST

He shot a bald eagle, ran it over and dragged it into the woods. https://t.co/fFe5k4J1im

Continue reading...

item.title: Red curtain falls: Trump Jr emails show Russia ties | The minute
item.description:
Got a minute? Trump Jr leapt at offer of ‘ultra sensitive’ ‘official documents and information’... from a ‘Russian government attorney’... and everything in US politics. By Tom McCarthy

10.49pm BST

Under pressure from the New York Times, Donald Trump Jr released emails containing shocking revelations of ties between Russia and the Trump campaign, feeding suspicions of foul play in the presidential election.

Read our coverage

10.49pm BST

In the emails, an intermediary offers Trump Jr a meeting with a “Russian government attorney” to pass “ultra sensitive” information as “part of Russia and its government’s support for Mr Trump”. Trump Jr replies: “If it’s what you say I love it.”

Full text of the emails

10.49pm BST

pic.twitter.com/8GChxQcyvr

10.48pm BST

Trump Jr says nothing came of the meeting. Earlier, he said he went into the meeting not knowing what it was about. Previously, he repeatedly denied any contact with Russians. Who to believe?

Trump camp denied Russian involvement at least 20 times

10.48pm BST

FLASHBACK: Don Jr. July 24, 2016. On the Clinton campaign's claims that the Russians were helping Trump: "It's disgusting. It's so phony." pic.twitter.com/xnD386ewMq

10.48pm BST

"Life's tough. Its even tougher if you're stupid" John Wayne

10.47pm BST

My son is a high-quality person and I applaud his transparency.

– President Donald Trump

10.47pm BST

.@DonaldJTrumpJr posted these emails after being informed that The New York Times was doing a story on them https://t.co/CgdD1xUIgt https://t.co/3SQWSccyZC

10.47pm BST

Stocks drop after Donald Trump Jr. posts emails on twitter https://t.co/Xccv8FHMQU pic.twitter.com/WcmXSpc6Gy

10.47pm BST

Republicans were quiet as the email fallout spread, but Democrats came out swinging. Former vice-presidential nominee Tim Kaine was not alone in using the word “treason”.

Dems come out swinging

10.47pm BST

Just about every single member of the Republican congress has signed on to a coverup without knowing what they're covering up.

Whoops.

10.47pm BST

Holy crap. If this is what NYT has, can you imagine what @TheJusticeDept has collected? https://t.co/0f0uSir9oA

10.46pm BST

It might take just a minute to catch up on the latest politics news. But good journalism takes time and costs money. If you like the Guardian’s politics coverage, please make a contribution. Thanks for reading!

Make a contribution today

10.46pm BST

Like, I absolutely understand why you would trust this guy to serve as an intermediary with the Russians. He's a pro. pic.twitter.com/WmgaTZpZFZ

10.46pm BST

Obamacare wont be repealed
There will be no tax cut
GOP sold its soul for 1 Scotus justice & temporary rollback of some EPA regs. https://t.co/Ig3SXy35uR

10.46pm BST

Congress hasn't done anything on health care or taxes or the budget, but the House will vote to rename a post office for Merle Haggard

Continue reading...

item.title: Trump Jr makes a giant mess on center stage | The minute
item.description:
Got a minute? President’s eldest son admits meeting Russian in hopes of Clinton dirt … now Trump Jr has hired lawyer … Republicans still trying on healthcare… and everything else in US politics. By Tom McCarthy

10.32pm BST

Donald Trump Jr confirmed a New York Times report that he had met a Russian lawyer a year ago in hopes of getting dirt on Hillary Clinton. He brought Jared Kushner and Paul Manafort to the meeting, he said. Then he stopped talking and hired a lawyer.

Trump Jr in trouble

10.32pm BST

Obviously I'm the first person on a campaign to ever take a meeting to hear info about an opponent... went nowhere but had to listen. https://t.co/ccUjL1KDEa

10.32pm BST

Trump Jr’s statement contradicted many vehement denials by team Trump that the campaign would ever have looked to Moscow for help beating Clinton. Now members of the Senate intelligence committee have expressed interest in speaking with Trump Jr.

Jr under pressure to testify

10.31pm BST

Happy to work with the committee to pass on what I know. https://t.co/tL47NOoteM

10.31pm BST

After his meeting with Vladimir Putin, Donald Trump announced the pair had “discussed forming an impenetrable Cyber Security unit” to guard against election hacking. That struck many as not much of a three-dimensional chess move on the president’s part.

Cyber thing off

10.30pm BST

The fact that President Putin and I discussed a Cyber Security unit doesn't mean I think it can happen. It can't-but a ceasefire can,& did!

10.30pm BST

Sarah Huckabee Sanders is "not sure" if Trump mentioned human rights at all in his conversation with Vladimir Putin

10.30pm BST

It might take just a minute to catch up on the latest politics news. But good journalism takes time and costs money. If you like the Guardian’s politics coverage, please make a contribution. Thanks for reading!

Make a contribution today

10.30pm BST

With three weeks to go before the August recess, Senate Republicans tried to pull together a healthcare reform bill, with zero signs of success. After that they have to attend to tax reform, infrastructure spending, the debt ceiling and the budget.

Clock ticking on healthcare bill

10.29pm BST

We are very close, Rush. If I have one message ... this is the moment, now is the time.

– Mike Pence to Rush Limbaugh, on repealing Obamacare

10.28pm BST

If Chelsea Clinton were asked to hold the seat for her mother,as her mother gave our country away, the Fake News would say CHELSEA FOR PRES!

10.28pm BST

Good morning Mr. President. It would never have occurred to my mother or my father to ask me. Were you giving our country away? Hoping not. https://t.co/4ODjWZUp0c

10.27pm BST

No president in history of polling has ever had an approval rating as low as Chris Christie's 15%.
Not Nixon, not W, not nobody. https://t.co/Sq1dAMfCtN

10.27pm BST

Second angry caller to Christie, "Mike from Montclair" calls him a bully and calls him a "fat ass." Christie calls him a communist.

10.27pm BST

Barack Obama, now hanging out in private air terminals taking pictures with babies who enter https://t.co/Mkhk5HdliM

10.26pm BST

Yes, we now have an official draft @TheRock political committee registered with the @FEC. pic.twitter.com/ylQxuZkOev

10.26pm BST

The video @realDonaldTrump released of his G20 meeting put to the national anthem of North Korea. pic.twitter.com/dFOeFIiS6h

10.26pm BST

Hilarious: US isolated at G20... (via @lectrr) #G19 pic.twitter.com/DtbhtWPQ1y

10.25pm BST

Remember when SecDef Mattis' phone # was leaked by WaPo pic? A HS student called him for interview. Mattis agreed: https://t.co/NNrYXl1cAH

Continue reading...

item.title: Who’s your Vladdy? Trump meets Putin | The minute
item.description:
Got a minute? Trump brings up election tampering … but appears to accept Putin’s denial … chummy rapport on display in extra-long meeting … and everything today in US politics. By Tom McCarthy

10.50pm BST

Donald Trump and Vladimir Putin met for two hours longer than scheduled at the G20 summit in Germany. Trump “pressed” Putin about election tampering, which Putin denied, the US secretary of state, Rex Tillerson, said afterward.

Analysis: Putin will claim win

10.50pm BST

Russian foreign minister Sergey Lavrov claimed afterward that Trump had accepted Putin’s assertion that Russia did not cyber-attack the US election. Tillerson declared the two sides had an “intractable disagreement” on the matter and Trump wanted to “move forward”.

Russia denies interfering

10.49pm BST

For Secretary Tillerson to say that this issue will remain unresolved is disgraceful – to give equal credence to the findings of the American intelligence community and the assertion by Mr Putin is a grave dereliction of duty and will only encourage Russia to further interfere in our elections in the future.

– Senate minority leader Chuck Schumer

10.48pm BST

Putin cracked down on dom opposition, annexed Crimea, propped up Assad & interfered in our elections. Of course, he wants to "move on."

10.48pm BST

Trump and Putin “connected very quickly”, Tillerson said afterward. “There was a very clear positive chemistry between the two.” A ceasefire in southern Syria was announced during the meeting, which the White House posited as evidence of new bilateral cooperation.

The situation in southern Syria

10.48pm BST

Putin cozied up to a receptive Trump by bashing the media. As reporters left the room, Putin leaned in and asked Trump: “Those are the ones who insulted you?” Chuckles ensued.

‘Those are the ones?’

10.47pm BST

Putin murders journalists. This isn't funny. Press freedom is a foundational American value. This is horrifying. https://t.co/sEcuNXULWc

10.47pm BST

Mansplaining, G20 style. Watch Angela Merkel’s eye-roll. pic.twitter.com/PXEI0WxyYH

10.46pm BST

Meanwhile, spouses separated at #G20 dinner -- @FLOTUS seated next to Putin. Go on ... pic.twitter.com/I5kUVFrKgd

10.46pm BST

Early Friday, Trump sent a tweet claiming: “Everyone here is talking about why John Podesta refused to give the DNC server to the FBI and the CIA. Disgraceful!” White House staff later admitted to reporters that no one at the G20 was talking about Podesta, the former Clinton campaign chairman.

The Putin-Trump pair

10.46pm BST

3/ Get a grip man, the Russians committed a crime when they stole my emails to help get you elected President.

10.45pm BST

7/7 Dude, get your head in the game. You’re representing the US at the G20.

10.45pm BST

A day of violent clashes between police and protesters culminated on Friday evening with police using water cannon, teargas and speed boats to keep at bay an angry crowd of thousands.
